git config --global alias.pull-all-remote-branches '!remote=origin ; for brname in `git branch -r | grep $remote | grep -v master | grep -v HEAD | awk '\''{gsub(/[^\/]+\//,"",$1); print $1}'\''`; do git branch --track $brname $remote/$brname  ; done'
